description.info: Designed a classic driving simulator to enjoy listening to music while on the road.

Key optimizations in this project include a floating origin system for seamless endless driving, a chunk loader with a managed pool for efficient asset handling, and procedurally generated trees optimally created in hundreds.
I participated in GitHub's Game Jam 2023, where I developed a top-down survival game based on the theme 'SCALE'.
The game, titled Overtime, challenges players to survive as long as possible while defeating waves of ninjas.
It features 5 unique stages, 5 different items, and 7 distinct enemies. I was responsible for designing all the models, textures, UI, and animations, as well as creating the background music.
Asteroids was my second project using SFML, where I set out to recreate the classic Atari Asteroids game.

A standout feature of this project was the scalable approach I implemented for rendering models. Rather than manually managing render lists in the main file, I developed a WindowManager class to handle the priority, activity, and rendering of models. This approach significantly helped reduce the load on other components within the game.
My Temple Run remake is an effort to faithfully recreate the original game in Unity.
This project showcases a wide range of Unity features, including sound, animation, UI, cutscenes, and more.
I also took on level design, crafting multiple stage paths using prebuilt assets, designing coin trails, and creating background environments.
Additionally, I optimized asset sizes and formats to ensure smooth performance in WebGL.
The Dinosaur game was my first project using SFML, where I recreated the classic Google Dinosaur game.
Unlike working with game engines like Unity, this project allowed me to build a more fundamental application, developing custom code for features such as object collision and movement.
I also worked with UV texture coordinates to animate sprites from sprite sheets.
PolyPop is a top-down shooter where the goal is to survive for as long as possible. Itâ€™s my first solo project created in Unity
The game includes classic app features like a minimap, scoreboard, and shop.
I applied various development design steps to guide the project, from defining game features to organizing my work with game design documents and UML diagrams.
I also began using Blender to create low-poly models for the game's environment and stages.
FallBall is an endless mobile arcade game where the objective is to keep a falling ball alive for as long as possible.
Developed in collaboration with a close friend back in 2020, this was my first ever game.
Through this project, I gained experience with Unity and Unity Remote 5, and learned the entire process of publishing a game on the Google Play Store.
We created over 23 unique maps with 3 different difficulty stages and added various features, including animations, music, and advertisements within Unity.
